  "title": "Senior Accountant / Financial Controller",
  "description": "HR-Aid Consults - Our client, an IT firm, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior Accountant / Financial Controller

Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities
Financial Planning, Control &amp; Reporting:


	Oversee day-to-day financial operations, budgeting, forecasting, and cash flow management.
	Lead the preparation and timely submission of financial statements, including:
	Management accounts (Income Statement, Balance Sheet, Cash Flow)


CBN/Regulatory returns:


	Monthly, quarterly, and annual reports for internal and external stakeholders
	Develop, monitor, and analyze budgets and financial performance. Conduct variance analyses and provide actionable insights.
	Prepare accurate cash flow forecasts to support liquidity and funding needs.
	Manage tax planning, computation, remittance, and statutory deductions (PAYE, VAT, WHT, etc.).


&nbsp;Compliance &amp; Internal Controls:


	Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations, including CBN guidelines, FIRS requirements, and IFRS standards.
	Establish and maintain robust internal control systems, policies, and procedures.
	Liaise with external auditors, regulators, and tax consultants.
	Ensure proper record-keeping, audit readiness, and risk mitigation.


&nbsp; Portfolio &amp; Credit Oversight (Supporting COO):


	Collaborate with the credit and risk teams to ensure quality loan underwriting, sound credit decisioning, and portfolio monitoring.
	Monitor credit performance and analyze delinquencies; support recovery efforts and portfolio remedial actions.
	Conduct periodic loan book and collateral reviews to ensure compliance with facility agreements.
	Support the COO in credit risk evaluation and monthly risk asset meetings.


&nbsp;Strategic Financial Advisory:


	Provide insights and recommendations to support the company&rsquo;s financial strategy, investment decisions, and operational improvements.
	Drive automation and digital transformation in the finance department.
	Track key financial metrics and performance indicators to support business goals.
	Assist in capital raising, investor relations, and business expansion strategies when required.


Key Qualifications and Experience


	&nbsp;Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration (required)
	&nbsp;Minimum of 7&ndash;10 years of progressive experience in financial management, preferably in a financial services or lending institution
	Qualified Accountant (ICAN/ACCA) &ndash; required
	&nbsp;Demonstrated experience in financial reporting, budgeting, tax, audit coordination, and regulatory reporting
	&nbsp;Strong understanding of credit risk, loan operations, and treasury management
	&nbsp;Hands-on experience with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Zoho Books) and advanced Excel skills
	&nbsp;Familiarity with Nigerian tax laws and CBN regulatory guidelines


Skills and Competencies


	Core Competencies:
	In-depth knowledge of financial accounting, controls, and performance management
	Ability to interpret financial data and draw strategic conclusions
	Ability to build, lead and motivate a finance team with integrity and accountability
	Knowledge of credit risk, financial risks, and regulatory risks
	Proficiency in accounting systems, automation tools, and reporting dashboards
	Ability to align financial management with overall business objectives


Soft Skills:


	Strong communication and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively under pressure
	Attention to detail and high levels of accuracy
	Results-oriented and proactive approach
	Critical thinker and problem-solver
	Client-focused mindset and commercial awareness.


Salary
N700,000&nbsp;- N800,000 per month.

Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should&nbsp;send their CV to:&nbsp;talent@hr-aidconsults.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",
